The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that an alien organism called Vaterra has killed them and turned them into camouflage monsters that never stop moving. Unfortunately for our heroes, they have already been infected by this alien organism. That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie, like going to the theater or whatever.

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over into other aspects of their lives until they are engulfed in payback wrath by another group of stick-up victims. (The wild-eyed ones with two spoons cut up into a heart shape on their faces were a great touch.)

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to create a cult phenomenon like the John Woo Bruce Lee martial arts films of the Sixties and Seventies. A TV series was made based on this movie because of its success at securing repeat viewers for NBC.
Extras include two unrelated short Snagglepuss cartoons
